terrain.desc: An area located in the Greenwich bourough of east London.
An area located in the Greenwich bourough of east London.
Town in Kent, England. Five miles from London. Located along the Thames River.
A Town in Kent, England. Located 30 miles from London, along River Medway.
A town in Kent, England. Located 45 miles from London, and 15 miles from Canterbury.
City with its own government, located in Kent.
Major ferry port in Kent, England accross the English Channel from Calais, France.
A port city in France accross the English Channel from Dover.
A large town located in Calais.
A town located in the Nord department of France.
A town in the Nord department of France.
A town located on the Deûle River near the border of France.
A bridge located outside of Tressin to the east, in route to Tournai
A Belgian city with the River Scheldt flowing through it.
Located within the city of Brussels.
Where the Meuse River meets the Sambre River.
Where the Meuse River meets the Ourthe River.
Located in the Ardennes mountains, south of Liège.
Located half way between Liège and Germany.
Also know as Aachen. Border town of Germany.
Also known Jülich. A Border town of Germany.
The Rhine flows through its center.
Roman Catholic Church located in Cologne.
Located 14 miles from Cologne, with The Rhine flowing through.
Bad Godesberg is a district located within Bonn, Germany. Contains the ruins of Godesberg.
The Rhine flowing to the east.
South of Remagen along the Rhine River.
South of Andernach, with the Rhine running through.
Lies along the Rhine, north of St. Goar.
Located along the middle of the Rhine.
Located along and next to Hunsrück mountians.
Located where the Rhine meets the Main river.
Lies accross the Rhine from Mainz.
West of Wiesbaden, with the Main running through its center.

note.p: Visited before returning to Kehl, Germany.
A hostel on the Great St. Bernard Pass. Pass-through, return?

terrain.desc: Located on the shore of Lake Zug between Righi and Rossberg

note.p: Where tourist gather to ascend Mount Righi

terrain.desc: Located on the shore of Lake Zug between Righi and Rossberg
Located along Lake Lauerz, and contains mountains Kleiner Mythen and Grosser Mythen.
Where the Limmat river flows into Lake Zurich.
The Lamat river flows along side.

note.p: Solothurn. Located along the Aar river within the Jura mountains.

terrain.desc: Lies at the foot of the Jura Mountains.
Located on Lake Neuchatel within the Jura Mountains.
South of Neuchatel. Surrounded with very low marshy and lately drained lands - stunted willows - large flat fields surrounded with poplars and long avenues for promenades.
Adjacent to Lake Geneva. A town with "fine trees giving to many parts the appearance of a grand park."
Cloth in Vegetation. Rhone River flows through town, split into two with houses built on island between.
Half way between Geneva and Chamouni.
Located in Chamouni valley in the Mont Blanc massif.
